enum.validValues: Use one of the following values: {{{ values }}}

addInvites.zero: Adding zero invites doesn't really make sense...

amount.positive: Added **{{ amount }}** invites for {{{ member }}}, now at: **{{ totalInvites }}** invites.
amount.negative: Removed **{{ amount }}** invites from {{{ member }}}, now at: **{{ totalInvites }}** invites.

args.user: The user that will receive/lose the bonus invites.
args.amount: The amount of invites the user will get/lose. Use a negative (-) number to remove invites.
args.reason: The reason for adding/removing the invites.

self.description: Adds/Removes invites to/from a member.

addRank.updated: Rank {{{ role }}} updated: Now needs {{ invites }} and has the following description: {{ description }}
addRank.created: Added rank {{{ role }}} which needs {{ invites }} and has the following description: {{ description }}
addRank.roleTooHigh: The role {{{ role }}} is higher up than my role ({{{ myRole }}}), so I won't be able to assign it to members that earn it.

args.role: The role which the user will receive when reaching this rank.
args.invites: The amount of invites needed to reach the rank.
args.info: A description that users will see so they know more about this rank.

self.description: Add a new rank.

config.title: Your config settings
config.text:
Below are all the config settings of your server.
Use `{{ prefix }}config <key>` to view a single setting
Use `{{ prefix }}config <key> <value>` to set the config <key> to <value>
config.canNotClear: The config setting **{{ key }}** can not be cleared. You can use `config {{ key }} default` to reset it to the default value.

current.title: Current Value
current.text:
This config is currently set.
Use `{{ prefix }}config {{ key }} <value>` to change it.
Use `{{ prefix }}config {{ key }} default` to reset it to the default.
{{! args.clear ? `Use \`${args.prefix}config ${args.key} none\` to clear it.` : '' !}}
current.notSet:
This config is currently **not** set.
Use `{{ prefix }}config {{ key }} <value>` to set it.

config.sameValue: This config is already set to that value.

changed.text:
This config has been changed.
Use `{{ prefix }}config {{ key }} <value>` to change it again.
Use `{{ prefix }}config {{ key }} none` to reset it to the default.

channel.canNotReadMessages: I don't have permission to **read messages** in that channel.
channel.canNotSendMessages: I don't have permission to **send messages** in that channel.
channel.canNotSendEmbeds: I don't have permission to **embed links** in that channel.

invalid.lang: Invalid language **{{ value }}**. The following languages are supported: {{ langs }}
invalid.leaderboardStyle: Invalid leaderboard style **{{ value }}**. The following styles are supported: {{ styles }}
invalid.rankAssignmentStyle: Invalid rank assignment style **{{ value }}**. The following styles are supported: {{ styles }}

args.key: The config setting which you want to show/change.
args.value: The new value of the setting.

self.description: Show and change the config of the server.

fake.title: Fake invites
fake.none: No fake invites detected so far.
fake.noneSinceJoin: There have been no fake invites since the bot has been added to this server.

entry.text: **{{ name }}** joined **{{ times }} times**, invited by:

args.page: Which page of the fake list to get.

self.description: Help find users trying to cheat.

help.text:
This is a list of commands you can use. You can get more info about a specific command by using \`{{ prefix }}help <command>\` (e.g. \`{{ prefix }}help add-ranks\`)

Arguments are listed after the command. Parentheses \`()\` indicate an **optional** argument. (e.g. \`(reason)\` means the \`reason\` is optional)

args.command: The command to get detailed information for.

self.description: Display help.

invitedMembers.none: This member has not invited anyone else so far

recommendedCode.none: Please create a permanent invite code.

invites.highestRank:
{{! args.target === args.self ? 'Congratulations, you currently have the highest rank!'
: `<@${args.target}> currently has the highest rank!` !}}

memberConfig.title: Your config settings
memberConfig.text:
Below are all the available config settings.

Use `{{ prefix }}config <key>` to view the users which have a `<key>` setting
Use `{{ prefix }}config <key> @user` to view the setting for a single `@user`
Use `{{ prefix }}config <key> @user <value>` to set the config `<key>` to `<value>` for `@user`
memberConfig.canNotClear: The config setting **{{ key }}** can not be cleared. You can use `config {{ key }} default` to reset it to the default value.
memberConfig.notSet: This config settings is currently not set for any members

current.title: Current Value
current.text:
This config is currently set.

Use `{{ prefix }}config ${key} @{{ username }} <value>` to change it.
Use `{{ prefix }}config ${key} @{{ username }} default` to reset it to the default.
{{! args.clear ? `Use \`${args.prefix}config ${args.key} @${args.username} none\` to clear it.` : '' !}}
current.notSet:
This config is currently **not** set.

Use `{{ prefix }}config {{ key }} @{{ username }} <value>` to set it.

memberConfig.sameValue: This config is already set to that value

changed.text:
This config has been changed.

Use `{{ prefix }}config ${key} @{{ username }} <value>` to change it again.
Use `{{ prefix }}config ${key} @{{ username }} none` to reset it to the default.

args.key: The config setting which you want to show/change.
args.user: The member that the setting is shown/changed for.
args.value: The new value of the setting.

self.description: Show and change the config of members of the server.
Show member count of current server.

setup.title: Setting up InviteManager
setup.text: After inviting the bot, all invites will be tracked automatically.

joinLeave.title: Setting join and leave message channel
joinLeave.text: If you want to display join and or leave messages in one of your channels, you have to configure that channel by doing `!config joinMessageChannel #channel` or `!config leaveMessageChannel #channel`. Make sure the bot has write permissions in those channels!

prefix.title: Changing the prefix
prefix.text:
You can change the prefix by doing `!config prefix !`

If you don't know the bots prefix, you can find it using `@InviteManager config prefix`.

faq.title: FAQs and more
faq.text:
Use the `!faq` command for more info, eg. how to change the prefix or customize the join/leave messages.

A complete guide on setting up the bot can be found here: https://github.com/AndreasGassmann/discord-invite-manager/

help.title: Help
help.text: If you need help or have feedback, you can either use the `!feedback` command or join our discord support server: {{ link }}

premium.title: Premium
premium.text:
If you would like to support the development of this bot, you can do so by supporting us on Patreon: {{ link }}

Depending on the tier, you will get some additional features.

manageGuild.title: Missing permission: Manage Server
manageGuild.text: The bot does not have the "Manage Server" permission. This permission is required to read the invites of the user. Without this permission the join messages won't work.

manageRoles.title: Missing permission: Manage Roles
manageRoles.text: The bot does not have the "Manage Roles" permissions. This permission is required to assign roles to a user. Without this permission members cannot be auto-promoted.

viewAuditLogs.title: Missing permission: View Audit Logs
viewAuditLogs.text: The bot does not have the `View Audit Logs` permissions. This permission allows the bot to better track invites.

self.description: Help with setting up the bot and checking for problems (e.g. missing permissions)

noPremium.title: This server currently does not have a premium subscription
noPremium.text: By subscribing to a premium tier you help the development of the bot and also get some additional features.

embeds.title: Premium Feature: Embeds in join messages
embeds.text:
You can use an embed in your join and leave messages which look a lot better.
[See some examples here]({{ link }})

export.title: Premium Feature: History export
export.text: You can export all the joins and leaves that happened on your server since you invited our bot.

premium.text:
This servers subscription is valid for another {{ date }}.

[What can I do with premium?]({{ link }})
